I already have this for starting tomcat....

<java classname="org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap"
fork="true">

Any other ideas?

- Billy -


On Fri, 1 Aug 2003 13:52:36 -0400, "Stirling, Scott"
wrote:





> -----Original Message-----
> From: billy.bacon@...
[mailto:billy.bacon@...]
[...]
> I have an ant target which starts tomcat and I have
> another target which calls the <junit> task to execute
> my unit tests...
> 
> My deploy.test target depends on starting tomcat and
> then makes an <antcall target> to my 'test' target
> which executes my tests. It seems to be hanging after
> tomcat is started successfully. Has anyone come across
> this issue before.
> 
> Example: 
> <target name="deploy.test" depends="clean, tc">
> <!-- clean target just deletes the build dir -->
> <!-- tc target starts tomcat -->
> <antcall target="test"> <!-- executes unit tests -->
> </target>

I'd guess you aren't forking the Java or the exec
you're using in the tc target to start Tomcat.

Scott Stirling
Framingham, MA
